item.title: Report X-2023070316
item.description:
Report X-2023070316

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: SUMTER
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A SEVEN PIECE SHIPMENT FROM SC TO HONG KONG WAS STOPPED FOR INVOICE INSPECTION AT THE UPS ORIGIN FACILITY IN SUMTER, SC WHEN SMOKE WAS NOTICED RELEASING FROM ONE OF THE BOXES. THE RESPONDER OPENED THE PACKAGE TO FIND LCD SCREENS FOR VARIOUS ELECTRONIC DEVICES. THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT RESPONDED AND ISOLATED THE WARM/SMOKING ITEMS WITH A TEMPERATURE GUN. SEVERAL LITHIUM ION BATTERIES WERE DISCOVERED STILL ATTACHED TO SOME OF THE LCD SCREENS. THE BATTERIES WERE CHARRED AND MELTED INDICATIVE OF A THERMAL EVENT. THE OUTER BOX SHOWS NO VISIBLE SIGNS OF A THERMAL EVENT. THE LCD SCREENS WITH ATTACHED BATTERIES INVOLVED IN THE THERMAL EVENT WERE ISOLATED AND ARE BEING HELD IN A SALVAGE DRUM FOR FAA INSPECTION. THE ADDITIONAL SIX BOXES WERE NOT OBSERVED TO CONTAIN ANY BATTERIES BUT ARE BEING HELD. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM SC USING UPS ACCOUNT 898FV2, TOPYET ELECTRONIC CO, UNIT 10/F BLK 03, KWUN TONG, HONG KONG. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023080110
item.description:
Report X-2023080110

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Came off of the trailer. Cap on top of can was leaking from the seam. Was noticed by Sort Manager Cameron Drake. Sort Manager contacted me. I placed Hazmat in a Hazmat bag and tote and placed it in the Damaged Hazmat cage. DescribePack: Leaking from the cap on top of the can at the seam. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bagged. Placed in Hazmat tote and put in the Damaged Hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023070209
item.description:
Report X-2023070209

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: North Charleston
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An overpack shipment was found leaking at the CHSA facility. The overpack was made up of four steel buckets on a wooden skid. While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed that the leak was coming from where the handle was attached to the bucket. There was no damage observed to the lids or bottom chimes. The leaking bucket was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023080127
item.description:
Report X-2023080127

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: MYRTLE BEACH
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package unloaded from trailer and was discovered to have small amounts of leakage on a corner of the package. It was placed upright and put into a hazard bin to be transferred to QA to follow procedure. DescribePack: When inspected, the issue was found to be only a loosely secured cap causing the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was faced upright to not allow any more spillage.
